ygData.subject: Trouble in the lab
ygData.msgSnippet: Ice or Shadow Wing, she was still the trusting soul she always was. Regaurdless of what he seems to be, he still hasn t earned my trust. Lunarpine didn t

Ice or Shadow Wing, she was still the trusting soul she always 
was. "Regaurdless of what he seems to be, he still hasn't earned my 
trust." Lunarpine didn't know whether it was paranoia or instinct but 
Veratis still hadn't shown what his true motives were. "What kind of 
being would preach peace and carry a virus that could wipe out an 
entire planet?" There was still to much to learn to fully understand 
thier host, but he was at least willing to give the old bot a chance.


In the lab The chamber opened to reveal a large green raptor, claws 
and teeth shining like stars at night. It made no movement to attack, 
the only movement it made was a loud roar and then stare at the two 
bots before it.

"Greetings" Veratis began, "I am Veratis, and this is Foxfingers." He 
tried to stay back in case of trouble. A sudden movement from 
Foxfingers set the raptor on immediate alert. Spotting the scarred 
maximal symbol set his functions spinning. With a quick jump it leapt 
forward, Foxfingers ducked in time to avoid the blow.

"Full alert, Lunarpine and Ice to the lab." Veratis shouted 
transforming to his half bat mode ready to defend himself. The raptor 
lashed out with it's tail connecting with Foxfingers chest. 
Foxfingers fought to maintain control but lost his balance. The 
raptor turned to attack again, "Razor Claw Terrorize." He transformed 
exactly like the origional dinobot but his head looked more 
insectoid. Antenna type ears rose above his head. He drew his sword 
for the deathblow.

Lunarpine hears Veratis' transmission, "We're needed," he exclaims 
unneededly, He knew that Ice probably heard the cry telepathically 
before the comm relayed it.

 --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Ice::
> 
> She turned and looked at Lunarpine. "What little game is that? From 
> what I've seen, this Veratis isn't a killer. He's not trying to 
harm 
> anyone. But what I don't understand is this prophecy of his. He 
keeps 
> thinking about it, but I can't see that far into his mind to really 
> understand it. OK, Sure he can be grumpy. But what game are you 
> refering to?" She was trying to keep her mind out of his.  She was 
> controlling it so that she wasn't jst reading the minds of the bots 
> near her. She would respect the thoughts of the other bots and not 
> get into thier heads. That is unless it was absolutely nessasary.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > "It's OK, You did real good." Lunarpine smiled since he now knew 
> where they
> > stood. "He told me a little about the prophecy. It seems like 
it's 
> almost a
> > religion to him and his group. The three of them seem almost 
> fanatical about
> > it." He walked past her a little, his back was now to her, "Let's 
> play thier
> > little game and see just what the next move is." He didn't 
exactly 
> trust the
> > scientist but wanted to repay the debt he owed. If that meant 
> pulling one of
> > his group out of trouble then that's what he'd do. He wouldn't 
drag 
> Ice into
> > this battle though, he still thought of her as the recon bot that 
> Shadow
> > Wing had been.
> > 
> > Veratis stood up for a moment holding his head. "Is there a 
> problem?"
> > Inquired Foxfingers as he placed a hand on his meantors back. 
> Veratis
> > glanced around the room, trying to regain his equilibreum, "I 
just 
> got dizzy
> > for a moment it's nothing to worry about."
> > 
> > The Protoform with the Raptor DNA was nearly complete. Veratis 
had 
> hoped
> > that the spark inside could be taught the ways of Prime. Time 
would 
> tell
> > just who or what would become of the new translife form.
> >
